data.title: WebM: VP8 and VP9 video codecs
data.body:
Is it in still plans?

If yes - has anyone started working on this? If not - I can integrate them with Godot using `libvpx` library (VP8, VP9 - video via libvpx; Vorbis, Opus - audio using existing libraries) :)

Discussion about VP8/VP9 was also in #5226 and #5784.

data.title: Deselecting a node with CTRL+BUTTON_LEFT is not updating the selection in 2D Scene view
data.body:
Deselecting a node with CTRL+BUTTON_LEFT is not updating the selection in 2D Scene view.

1.Create a scene with 2 nodes
2.Select Node1(In scene dock)
3.Hold CTRL and Left Click on Node2 
4.Go to 2D Scene View and see 2 Selections
5.Hold CTRL and Left Click on Node2(Deselect in scene dock)
6.Look at 2D Scene View still 2 Selections

Moving the mouse into the 2D Scene View is updating the View and then shows the correct selection.

data.title: Fix crash when GraphNode wasn't a child of a Control
data.body: Fixes #5761.

data.title: Game Window Placement's Rect unpredictably offset get_viewport().get_mouse_pos()'s origin
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit, Godot 2.0.4.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The setting
Game Window Placement > Rect > Centered (and maybe others, have not tested them proper)
...offset **get_viewport().get_mouse_pos()'s** origin point unpredictably when in **fullscreen**
origin just hovers somewhere in the top-left area of viewport

**Steps to reproduce:**
use get_viewport().get_mouse_pos() to find mouse pos in viewport
print mouse pos on any label
set game to start in fullscreen
with Game Window Placement > Rect > not default (centered was tested in my case)
**Result:** get_viewport().get_mouse_pos()'s origin will be off top-left corner

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Unfortunately I'm not on my working machine when reporting this. Sorry.

data.title: Project Manager: Added project list scrolling with keyboard
data.body:
The following keys are being handled: <kbd>↑</kbd>, <kbd>↓</kbd>, <kbd>Home</kbd>, <kbd>End</kbd>.

I am not sure if <kbd>Page Up</kbd> and <kbd>Page Down</kbd> are needed nor how far they should scroll.

Closes #1481

data.title: Viewport: Replace obsolete "windows" group calls
data.body:
I am not familiar with this code, so I am not sure if this line should replace the previous one.

I found it's being used as an addition in two other places:
- [scene/main/viewport.cpp#L1856-L1857](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/f93e333e85191a467f87143cf1edec0829595767/scene/main/viewport.cpp#L1856-L1857)
- [scene/main/viewport.cpp#L1933-L1934](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/f93e333e85191a467f87143cf1edec0829595767/scene/main/viewport.cpp#L1933-L1934)

It replaces the previous group call in two other places:
- [scene/main/viewport.cpp#L1785-L1786](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/f93e333e85191a467f87143cf1edec0829595767/scene/main/viewport.cpp#L1785-L1786)
- [scene/main/viewport.cpp#L2065-L2066](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/f93e333e85191a467f87143cf1edec0829595767/scene/main/viewport.cpp#L2065-L2066)

And it's missing in favour of the group call in one place:
- [scene/main/viewport.cpp#L2105](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/f93e333e85191a467f87143cf1edec0829595767/scene/main/viewport.cpp#L2105)

This is another place where the _"windows"_ group is being used for a different purpose:
- [scene/main/viewport.cpp#L2359](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/f93e333e85191a467f87143cf1edec0829595767/scene/main/viewport.cpp#L2359)

data.title: Cannot get world-space normal in fragment shader
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.0.4, Windows 10 64 bits

I need to get the world-space normal of the model in a fragment shader, however all my attempts have failed so far.
There is no access to `SRC_NORMAL`, which is only available in the vertex shader.
I also tried to use the formula indicated in the [documentation](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/reference/shading_language.html#examples):

``` glsl
// Use reverse multiply because INV_CAMERA_MATRIX is world2cam
vec3 world_normal = NORMAL * mat3(INV_CAMERA_MATRIX);
```

However this throws an error:

```
Error precompiling shader: Invalid arguments to function/constructor: mat3
```

![terraineditor_shader_error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/17079307/551578aa-510c-11e6-9498-2c3b3201450a.png)

Note: if it's actually possible, maybe it's a documentation issue because the above line doesn't works.

data.title: Subarray patch
data.body: This is a fresh version of the subarray patch for `DVector` properly put into its own branch.  Please see #5765

data.title: The editor glitches when the material preview is shown
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1 beta, Windows 10 64 bits

When I open a material in the inspector, several glitches occur:
- The mouse cursor no longer changes and blinks when hovering dock splitters
- Using Ctrl+S makes the editor crash (but I didn't managed to reproduce it afterwards).
- The console window has display giltches or looses its scrollbar (same, didn't managed to reproduce it).

The project where I had these glitches was the same as #5877, so maybe some of the glitches are related.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/379872/ShaderUniform3D.zip

data.title: Creating a uniform in a MaterialShader breaks rendering
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.0.4 and 2.1 beta, Windows 10 64 bits

I created a fragment shader for a material on a MeshInstance. But as soon as I create a uniform, the vertex shader is no longer applied and an error spam-prints in the console:

```
ERROR: ShaderGLES2::get_custom_uniform_location: Index p_idx out of size (version->custom_uniform_locations.size()).
   At: .\drivers/gles2/shader_gles2.h:336
```

I expected the vertex shader would be generated if empty, and there should be no error in this shader.

Test project:
[ShaderUniform3D.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/379872/ShaderUniform3D.zip)

Open the material override in the MeshInstance, open the shader, select fragment shader, and uncomment the uniform (or create any).
Notice the sphere is now stretched to the whole screen as if no vertex shader was applied.

Because of this I cannot create a terrain shader properly :(

data.title: Importing a 3D mesh is slowed down by printing
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1 and 2.0.4, Windows 10 64 bits

When I import an OBJ file as a mesh, the console prints a message for every vertice it contains, which is slowing down the import considerably:

```
vtx: 6/482
vtx: 7/482
vtx: 21/482
vtx: 21/482
vtx: 7/482
vtx: 22/482
vtx: 451/482
vtx: 0/482
vtx: 15/482
vtx: 14/482
vtx: 330/482
...
```

It took me 5 seconds to import a simple sphere, and 30 seconds to import a regular model.

data.title: Fix warnings in core/variant_op.cpp
data.body:
Fixes #5587.
The fix suggested by @vnen in #5587 was correct (it has the exact same result but without the warning). I also fixed the warnings related to missing cases in switches, so that the file doesn't produce any warnings.

data.title: VisibilityNotifier2D can't resolve its connected signals when opened in the editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x64, git master HEAD

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When opening a scene in the editor with a VisibilityNotifier2D which has connected signals, errors are printed in the console mentioning that the corresponding callbacks can't be resolved, e.g.:

```
ERROR: emit_signal: Error calling method from signal 'enter_screen': 'Node2D(Node2D.gd)::_on_VisibilityNotifier2D_enter_screen': Method not found.
   At: core/object.cpp:1215.
ERROR: emit_signal: Error calling method from signal 'exit_screen': 'Node2D(Node2D.gd)::_on_VisibilityNotifier2D_exit_screen': Method not found.
   At: core/object.cpp:1215.
```

These errors are misleading and wrong, as those methods exist in the referenced script.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a scene with a VisibilityNotified2D and a script
2. Bind the `_enter_screen` and `_exit_screen` signals to functions in the script.
3. Save the scene and close it.
4. Reopen the scene; the console should should errors as above.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[bug_signals_in_editor.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/379843/bug_signals_in_editor.zip)

data.title: Cryptography for arrays and strings.
Locals Inspector shows wrong values on debugger
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10. Godot version 2.0.4.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Locals Inspector shows wrong values on debugger. When a local variable has a value greater than 65535, the inspector shows 65535

**Steps to reproduce:**

1 - Create a new project. 
2 - Add a root node. 
3 - Attach this script called main.gd to the root node.

extends Node

func _ready():
    var my_integer = 9999999
        print(my_integer)

4 - Put mouse over my_integer and see the value 9999999
5 - In the local's window, shows the wrong number 65535
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15801379/17075451/fe935ada-5069-11e6-83a7-322d2e71582d.png)

```
#42 0x0000000000f0487f in SceneTree::input_event (this=0x39943c0, p_event=...) at scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp:431

```

Initially reported by @puppetmaster- who had it crash with the same image. Other similar images don't trigger the crash, you can try with those in https://github.com/puppetmaster-/darkhours/blob/master/resources/ui/.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Open the attached project
- Try to set the included PNG file as texture for the Sprite
- See that it segfaults

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[textureregioneditor_crash.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/379200/textureregioneditor_crash.zip)

data.title: Upgrade FreeType to upstream version 2.6.5
data.body: Fixes #5859, related to #5248.

data.title: Fix ItemList.clear() not removing separators
data.body: Fixes #5817.

data.title: Upgrade FreeType from 2.5.0 to 2.6.5
data.body:
Our embedded FreeType code should be upgraded from our current version (2.5.0) to the latest upstream one (2.6.5).

I'm working on it right now, but opening this issue to document the process for reference.

data.title: Rendering problems on intel graphics with acceleration method "sna"
data.body:
A lot of sprites cause screen to flicker in fullscreen mode. Everything seems to be normal in window mode. Also everything seems to be normal with acceleration method set to "uxa" in xorg.conf. Looks like intel driver overrides vsync parameter causing screen to flicker, even when "TearFree" parameter is disabled in xorg.conf. It turns into a problem since "sna" acceleration method is default by intel driver. The bug was tested on two computers with intel graphics on different linux distros.

Tested on: Linux - Godot v2.1 beta

GPU: Intel® HD Graphics 4600

Example project: [Sprites Flicker Test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/378409/Sprites.Flicker.Test.zip)

data.title: Fix ItemList elements being wrongly selected
data.body:
Fixes #5772.
I found the origin of the bug (see commit message), but maybe there are things in the editor or games making use of this behavior (which would be surprising because it's broken), so merge with caution :)
Also I cleaned up some of the code in item_list.cpp in the first commit, but I can rebase if it's better in another PR/can be improved/...
